intro: Wodyetia, commonly known as the arrowhead plant, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Araceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas, particularly Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white flowers that are followed by bright red berries. Wodyetia species are often grown as ornamental plants due to their attractive foliage and ability to thrive in moist environments. They prefer partial to full shade and well-draining soil, making them suitable for both indoor and outdoor cultivation.
